term: a man/woman after your own heart
a rod/stick to beat somebody with
as/so far as I am concerned
as/so far as somebody/something is concerned
be in a minority of one
be of one/the same mind (about somebody/something)
be on a collision course (with somebody/something)
don’t judge a book by its cover
far be it from me to do something (but…)
go, swim, etc. with/against the tide
go to the mat (with somebody) (for somebody/something)
have a good, bad, high, low, etc. opinion of somebody/something
have a mind of your own
in the first, second, etc. place
in the sight of somebody/in somebody’s sight
put in your two cents’ worth
sing from the same hymn/song sheet
somebody can take it or leave it
take a dim view of somebody/something
take, claim, seize, etc. the moral high ground
there’s something, not much, etc. to be said for something/doing something
think the world, highly, a lot, poorly, little, etc. of somebody/something
to beard the lion in his den
you, he, she, etc. started it
